website_summaries.verdict: Unique shape conforms to babies face, leaving the nose clear at all times.
pros: Soft, durable silicone doesn't have detectable odors or tastes for those hard to please babies
Open nose area lets baby breathe freely
cons: Tougher silicone than other newborn pacifiers, which some babies reject

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Darn Durable
customer_reviews.text: I know this sounds absolutely ridiculous, but I actually bought these for my kitten. He suckled our ears and eyebrows when he’s sleepy and it was keeping us up at night and making our skin rash. We put kitten formula on them and he suckles these instead now. I just thought actual moms would be interested to know that sharp kitty teeth haven’t punctured even after several days and they were super easy to clean by throwing them until a cup of boiling water for a couple minutes. So... yeah! This household is very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: ... in size and shape as soothies but have the awesome cut out for their nose
customer_reviews.text: These are just a hair smaller in size and shape as soothies but have the awesome cut out for their nose. The only downside is the material! It attracts dog hair like crazy and has less give than any other pacifier I've tried so far. My second child loved these but I'm still searching for one my third child will take. I have added photos of some various pacifiers for comparison from left to right: MAM 0+, NUK Newborn, The First Years GumDrop Newborn, Jollypop Preemie, Avent Soothie 0-3m, Born Free Bliss, Gerber First Essentials Soft Letex Center Pacifier I cut the tab off of the soothie to reduce weight.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Breastfed baby must!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a breastfed baby that won't take a pacifier, and you're at your wits end. Try this one! It is the only paci my baby girl will take and after wanting to be latched for 2-3 hours at a time these things are basically a godsend!
customer_reviews.author: Alysha

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have never written a review for anything but do not buy these pacifiers! My daughter, who is only two weeks old, had used one of the pacifiers maybe 5 times and today my husband saw that the nipple was dangling on just barely! If we had given it to our daughter she easily could’ve choked! We didn’t even have to wash it again yet that’s how few times it had been used! I am terrified because in the middle of the night I had tried to give this to her but she refused it and thanks GOD she did....do yourself a favor and just try a different pacifier.
customer_reviews.author: MKA2015

customer_reviews.title: Hard for baby to suck and hold on to
customer_reviews.text: They are super awkward and hard for my baby to suck and hold on to. constantly falls out of his mouth ( and he easily takes any pacifier or bottle) It was a total waste of money which is unfortunate because I liked the colors and softness/shape of plastic it didn’t smush into his nose like others that’s only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great for breastfeeding babes
customer_reviews.text: Only paci our 2month old will take to fall asleep! She would only allow momma to comfort her to sleep on the breast. These paci finally replace that for her! Great for breastfeeding babes!!!
customer_reviews.author: BurnsNation

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 4 weeks old and refuses to take a pacifier. She has accepted this one a few times until she realizes it isn’t a nipple and she gets mad. It is helpful with the hole to put your pinky in to let baby chew for a min. We have had more success with this type of “soothie” pacifier like the hospital gives you. It is nice that it has a cut out for their nose too. Product is made well and pink and purple colors are fun.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Stiff but okay
customer_reviews.text: These are quite stiff compared to the exact pacifier that my niece received in the hospital despite being the exact same product - either way she used.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Harwood

customer_reviews.title: They are great and they satisfied my cousin baby need because she ...
customer_reviews.text: They are great and they satisfied my cousin baby need because she had a whole lot of pacifiers but would only suck this 1 pacifier that was brought home with her from the hospital . And one day for a period of time she was without it and oh my GOD , that's why I had to find that style and got her some more , because I don't ever want to see that side of her baby or no other baby again . So I got so saved up just in case if I come in contact with anyone else with a baby with that type of a problem .
customer_reviews.author: SHIRLEY  FOGLE

customer_reviews.title: Well designed to fit under the nose
customer_reviews.text: My girls had a problem with the popular Avent pacifiers. When using them it would also hit their nose and squish it like a piggy. Had to find something with a short bridge where it didn’t interfere with their nose. Found these at Walmart and tried them. Perfect!!! Not sure if it’s because my girls have small lips or what, but if your babies don’t like the pacifier hitting their nose, this is a great option
customer_reviews.author: TwinMomma

customer_reviews.title: Tried many, always return to this style
customer_reviews.text: I love these pacifiers for my babies. They're the only ones my daughter would take. Also, my favorite part is that they are designed to be one piece, unlike many of the others that are 2 or more pieces. Many of the two piece pacifiers get moisture inside the actual nipple part. Also, it eliminates my fear of having the pacifier coming apart (this may be an irrational fear but real for me regardless). The material is super sturdy and very easy to sanitize.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: To big for baby’s mouth, collect’s all the hair and lint in the house.
customer_reviews.text: These collect more hair and lint than any others and baby just doesn’t enjoy how long the part that goes into her mouth is and she usually gags on it. Might be okay for a big baby or an older baby. My petite 3 mo old just doesn’t accept these. Lastly the part you hold onto is pretty stiff and not very soft or pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: M Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great bright colors, quality pacifiers, good price!
customer_reviews.text: My baby really likes these. He started out with the Soothies pacifiers and these have the exact same nipple shape. I ordered these mainly for the colors, which are great. They have a nice cutout for a pacifier clip. Only downside is that the pacifier works best in one position only since there is no comfy groove for their nose if turned upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazed

customer_reviews.title: Works great! And soft for baby.
customer_reviews.text: I love these because they are soft and gummy for my baby to chew on them and I don't have to worry about her hurting herself on hard plastic. It does have a piece of plastic in the inside of it to give it decent structure, which I didn't like at first compared to the NICU paci, but I don't mind it one bit now. I think this is a great cheaper option than the NICU paci and my daughter likes them just as well. Very cute! =)
customer_reviews.author: BrentaNeas

customer_reviews.title: My kid rejected these but they seem durable
customer_reviews.text: My son does not like this brand of pacifier at all, but they do seem more durable than some of the other brands I’ve tried. My son tends to like clear, flat shaped pacifiers but other kids like these. I think you just have to experiment and see what your kid prefers.
customer_reviews.author: charjitsu

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: These pacifiers are easy to clean, and great as babies get older and tried chewing and pulling. These are solid rubber and safe for the babies teething habits. They don’t come apart like normal pacifiers would. And easy to check for defaults as the baby gets older with teething.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie Colt

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These worked very well for my first child. She loved them. They are for newborns but she used them until she was about 1 1/2. They are similar to the ones the hospital gave us. My second child doesn't like pacifiers but we tried these with him anyways and he still don't like them (but that s his personal choice).
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: great for newborns
customer_reviews.text: These are made all in one piece so there is no choking risk. They are very smooth and a good size for the mouth of a newborn. They have no hidden ridges or anything so they are also easy to keep clean and stand up well to teething babies. Very durable. I would definitely recommend these to other parents with young infants.
customer_reviews.author: Ionia FromentTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: My daughter didn’t like these but every baby is different. I was disappointed thinking these would be similar to soothies. They’re hard and have a smaller nipple. Would not recommend. I gave in and just decided to buy soothies. My daughter loves soothies.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: A trusted friend of the grand baby.
customer_reviews.text: The grand baby won’t accept other pacifiers. These help with comforting her, soothing her teething, and helping her to sleep. She’ll wake in the middle of the night searching for it only to sigh happily and doze. These for newborns and older.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Samiya

customer_reviews.title: Love love love these!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using gumdrop pacifiers for years now, and I just love them. Easy to clean, no parts that can separate or cause choking issues, and cute colors. Highly recommend! We purchase for all friends and family who have babies.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Item as described
customer_reviews.text: got this for my newborn but is a little heavy for him and he couldn't hold it long enough so my 3yr old is using it and he likes it he used to chew on all the pacifiers and brakes them but so far is been a little over a month and still intact !
customer_reviews.author: Gloryvee88

customer_reviews.title: Good/Safe Pacifiers
customer_reviews.text: Great pacifiers. My son likes them. I like the solid one piece construction because it seems safer than the traditional plastic with clear nipples attached versions. It is easy to clean and soft feeling. I am happy with this choice.
customer_reviews.author: S. Anne

customer_reviews.title: Not the One for Us.
customer_reviews.text: In an effort to get my daughter to take a pacifier, I ordered every kind of pacifier out there. Unfortunately these did not work for us and she would just spit them out as soon as they were offered. I will mention that there is not a way to connect it to the pacifier clips that clip to a babies shirt so they don’t get lost as easily.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Just like the Hospitals
customer_reviews.text: I have 10 of these throughout our day to day life and I had no intention of ever using a pacifier. These are now attached to the car seat, in the car, the crib, nightstand, coffee table. Love them. Closest I found to the pacifier my daughter was given in the NICU.
customer_reviews.author: MOMSlist

customer_reviews.title: Big - and my daughter hated them
customer_reviews.text: They're a little hard, but my daughter WILL NOT take a pacifier. Tried these after someone recommended them for babies who dont take pacifiers, and these were no different. She hated them. And they're kinda huge.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Wright

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SAVER!
customer_reviews.text: These are my grandson's favorite pacifiers! I was so glad to find them on Amazon! They are well made, easy to attach to a pacifier clip, easy to clean and CUTE!
customer_reviews.author: Laura McKnight

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved these
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved these, even more than she liked the soothie ones. She stuck to the softer newborn ones the entire time and we never had problems with holes or rips. Easy to clean and sanitize and I like that there is a hole in the back for a paci clip.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Same as the passy from the hospital
customer_reviews.text: This is the closest thing to the hospital passy they give you.. my son will only take that nipple, and he will take these as well because the nipple is almost the exact same.
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela Rush

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately these didn’t work for my LO
customer_reviews.text: My LO isnt much of a pacifier type of baby. I thought I would give these a try to help him soothe himself but no luck. These are really similar to soothies but not as large and the nipple isnt as long. However my LO didnt like it. He still preferred the soothies even though those barely did it for him and actually seemed to make him gag at times. Would recommend to babies who actually like pacifiers, they might enjoy these
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: perfect pacifiers.
customer_reviews.text: These are the only pacifiers our baby will use. They are very durable and we have purchased them 3 times to make sure we always know were one is lol
customer_reviews.author: Ryan and Marina

customer_reviews.title: Just like from hospital
customer_reviews.text: Just like what was given at the hospital. It came in stating 0-3 months which worried me, because my baby didn't like the thicker pacifier, but when I compared it to the one I got from the hospital (newborn) it seemed to not be any thicker and baby is using it fine. I nurse and give him a pacifier between feedings, not that he always likes it, but so far haven't had nipple confusion
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great Pacifier
customer_reviews.text: Obviously every baby is different, but these were the only Pacifiers that worked for my newborn. Rather have the pacifier than the thumb. Easy to wash. I throw them in a Medula steamer bags after I wash them. Doesn't destroy them and I know they are sterilized. I was told by my pediatrician you should change the pacifier daily because bacteria and fungi can grow on them if you keep them in use for long periods of time without swapping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit harder than the soothie pacifiers. Also, my baby started making a clicking sound when using these. I tossed them at that point so that he wouldn't learn any bad habits that would mess up his breastfeeding.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: The pacifiers are too stiff for a newborn. I ...
customer_reviews.text: The pacifiers are too stiff for a newborn. I purchased Jolly pop to replace these they are the brand the hospital uses and are much softer.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra E. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome pacifiers. Recommended by a friend and she was right, perfect for young babies. My baby took right to them. Since then, we’ve moved up to the next size of the same brand. Definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Hollie W.

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these pacifiers!! I’ve used them with both my girls! Don’t cover the nose and comes in different sizes depending on age! 10/10 recommend
customer_reviews.author: christinestoker

customer_reviews.title: Favorite pacifier of our baby/toddler girl, with a cool feature, durable too
customer_reviews.text: The favorite pacifier for our baby/infant. A cool feature of this pacifier is that you can looks through the handle to see the lips of your baby/infant moving like a fish! Sometimes the baby/toddler enjoys sticking her finger to the hole while sucking on the pacifier. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Good for breastfeeding baby
customer_reviews.text: My son liked these as they are closer to a “nipple”. We introduced a pacifier after 6 weeks so he didn’t want just any pacifier. He likes this one and the mam paci.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Good value; one piece is easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is a good deal. The pacifier is in one piece, so you don't have to worry about soap or lingering bacteria being trapped somewhere. I wouldve given it more stars but my daughter keeps spitting it out. That's all the intel I can give you.
customer_reviews.author: K2 Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Great Pacifiers
customer_reviews.text: I found these to be very similar to the ones in the hospital but better. They have a material that my baby loved more than the one she got in the hospital. I'm glad it brings two that way I can have them in two places around the house and not go crazy looking for one when I really need it.
customer_reviews.author: MiamiLadyLiving

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Almost the same like his previous pacifier but he gagged about 3 times on this one. We’ll keep monitoring to see if this keeps happening? Otherwise a good product .
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: The best for many reasons!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these because they are incredibly easy to wash. I initially had the Nuk brand pacifiers for my daughter, but every time I would submerge them in hot, soapy water the inside of the nipple would fill with soapy water. These were the solution to my problem. I hand wash all of her bottles several times a day and it's so easy to quickly wash these with them. With the dip for the nose, these will fit a newborn just fine. I would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Not for my baby
customer_reviews.text: Ok these are adorable and perfect size. But my baby hated them. They are too plastic, silicone like and I think that's what my baby didn't like. Otherwise these are great in size and shape.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Nice pacies. My first loved the tomee tepee brand or whatever theyre called so well see what my second baby thinks of this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Valentina

customer_reviews.title: They are great for once baby is rolling around
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these pacifiers so many times. They are great for once baby is rolling around. Once my daughter was only enough and rolling in her sleep, it was nice that these would stay in because they are rounded. My daughter prefers these pacifiers to the nuk which I could never get her to take. The part that goes in baby's mouth is just like what most hospitals give so it was a seamless transition.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Extremely hard material, attracks dust/lint/dirt
customer_reviews.text: Baby could not keep in mouth. Nipple is the only soft part, the remainder is hard almost like it has metal inside. Has no give. Also attracks every bit of dust/lint/fuzz/dirt, even from a cotton burp cloth when wiped off
customer_reviews.author: Zwandel

customer_reviews.title: The only pacifier my breastfeeding baby will use
customer_reviews.text: In preparation for our newborn I purchased/was gifted a number of different pacifiers to try, knowing he was likely only going to like one or two, and this is by far the favorite. For a bit of context he arrived a couple weeks early but hasn't had any latch problems. The other's we have tried don't seem to do anything for him but he is a fan of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: YMMV
customer_reviews.text: I can really only go by what my baby liked for this review since I'm not usually interested in using a pacifier myself, and he didn't like these. They have a place on the bottom there that sticks out and I think he found it hard to nuzzle up against me with that there. A waste of money for me, but YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: ndamick

customer_reviews.title: Hard pass on these.
customer_reviews.text: These pacifiers are really hard to keep in the child’s mouth. They’re really big and awkward. We started using Mam pacifiers from Walmart. They have been a much better choice. Pro tip: Tie one onto the car seat with paracord (make sure it’s not too long though to wrap around the neck).
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I got these at my baby shower and I am so glad! My baby use to take any paci, but around 3 months he favored these and would only take them. So glad I found them in here and ordered a 5 pack to litter around the house and bags! My baby is mainly breastfed but also supplements every once in a while with bottle. So grateful for these!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Son likes soothies
customer_reviews.text: I finally got my 4 week old to take it. He loves the soothie pacifiers, but I hate how big they are. He finally took these and I'm happy with them
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: These have been the go-to pacifier for all 5 of my kiddos! So easy to clean and they don’t crack or break as easily as other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2fly

customer_reviews.title: Picky Baby
customer_reviews.text: The only binky my picky baby will take. I do like how I can use my finger inside the binky. Makes it easier to keep it from falling out. It may also be nice to see what’s going on when he’s teething.
customer_reviews.author: Crunchy mama

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and I can put them in the ...
customer_reviews.text: The only pacifier my son will use. Small enough for his little mouth but shaped so that it doesn't just fall out either. Easy to clean and I can put them in the dishwasher with his bottle parts since it's all silicone.
customer_reviews.author: NurseBS88

customer_reviews.title: Very similar to Avent Soothie
customer_reviews.text: Our baby only takes these and the Soothies. These are the same shape, but a tad smaller than the 0+ Avent Soothies.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: My son didn't like this pacifier at all, he spits it out every time. I think one of the reason might be the plastic material is too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for my kid
customer_reviews.text: My little one doesn’t like these. He spits them out consistently, but will take the Mam and Nuk
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: 5⭐
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved gumdrop pacifiers. Its one whole piece and easy to clean. Others get moldy inside 😬🤮 these are GREAT! I use them just to sooth the little one and once they are asleep? Take it out. I always recommend these to anyone who has a new baby. They are great ❤
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Macedo

customer_reviews.title: Momma approved!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my boys enjoy this shape of paci! Personally as a momma, I prefer these over the full round pacis with this shape because I’m actually able to attach a paci lip holder to them but also I can ensure their nose isn’t being blocked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pacifier!
customer_reviews.text: They are very similar to the pacifiers we got from the hospital, which was the only kind our son would like. They are just a lot firmer so they don't bend as easily. The only complaint we have is that they are a magnet for hair and blanket fuzz! EVERYTHING sticks to them!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Jolly

customer_reviews.title: The only kind she'll use
customer_reviews.text: We bought every cute pacifier under the sun for our daughter but she will only take the First Years GunDrops. Good thing they come in a bunch of colors and we just accessorize with paci straps. This six pack is a total steal and now we don't have to worry that we'll ever find outselves without one in case the dog eats one or one gets left at grandmas or whatever just seems to happen with babies and pacifiers. Do yourself a favor and get a bunch to have on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Momma Brand

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Easy to clean! One solid piece! Forms to his face. The only pacifier he likes! Can boil.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: THE Best pacifiers!
customer_reviews.text: These pacifiers are the ONLY kind my babies will take, and they spit out the fancier ones (fancy meaning the “nipple shaped” ones and so on). This 5-pack is the best deal as we are always looking for the baby’s favorite paci. These work great with pacifier cups too!
customer_reviews.author: TXLA

customer_reviews.title: The best binkies!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter only wanted these specific pacifiers when she was small. They are the best binkies for any baby. I know my son will love them too when he comes. No other paci beats these.
customer_reviews.author: Kendal Laurin

customer_reviews.title: Good pacifiers
customer_reviews.text: Great pacifiers and super easy to clean. other pacifiers are made up of multiple pieces joined together that allow water to get inside the pacifier and makes it tricky to clean. This gumdrop style eliminates that issue completely
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear

customer_reviews.title: Daughter Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased more variations of pacifiers than I care to admit but I am happy to report that these, and only one other type - that is actually VERY similar to these, only the large part is not "lip shaped" but a big round circle are what my daughter prefers. All other pacifiers we have purchased are sterilized and on standby "just in case" she ever changes her mind, but for the past 3 months this has been her pacification and soothing method of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Troublebaker

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The only pacifier my newborn was willing to take and soothed her. She spits it out mostly gonna try tommy teepee
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Hospital Pacis for the win!
customer_reviews.text: These are what our hospital provides for babies and we needed more for sure! These came in quickly and do their job :)
customer_reviews.author: Megan E.

customer_reviews.title: I like that they have a spot for her nose so ...
customer_reviews.text: My newborn took these with no problems. I like that they have a spot for her nose so she can breath a little easier, and the middle being open is convenient to hold in place in babies mouth with a finger.
customer_reviews.author: Breezy

customer_reviews.title: Fun colors
customer_reviews.text: Great little pacifiers that are similar to the Soothies but supposed to stay closer to the babies face, so they slip out less. I can't say whether they actually do slip out less... Seems about the same.The only thought I have is that they cut a little Low on the babies lip so part of the lip is sticking over the pacifier. The feeling would annoying me, but I guess doesn't seem to bother the baby too much
customer_reviews.author: J. Gessner

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any new baby!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most pacifiers on the market, that are listed as 0-3 months...these are actually made for newborns. They are better than any of the other pacis that are more expensive.The nipple on these are smaller and easier for them to attach to. The pacifier is hollow in the middle so they can actually suck the pacifier and keep it in their mouth without you holding it the whole time. The work great in steamer or the dishwasher to sanitize. This is truly a MUST purchase, regardless of you like pacifiers or not...a great back up plan!
customer_reviews.author: colleen bundy

customer_reviews.title: Same as hospital but not the same as Soothie
customer_reviews.text: These are the same as the ones we were given in the hospital (Hawaii medical). They are not the same size as the soothie round pacifiers as the nipple on these is noticibly smaller. I was hoping my son would take to these to have one with a nose cut out but unfortunately that's not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Cortney V

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pacifier
customer_reviews.text: I wish I can find for 6 months and above, it has been difficult, it is a very nice pacifier, she loves it. Comfortable for her to hold it
customer_reviews.author: Ana Lagos

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: These are the only pacifiers my daughter will use. They are hard to find in stores, so I was grateful they were available on Amazon. They came in a package of 5, and they are exactly as described. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DCOkie

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: These are very hard on the edges like they have metal in them. She couldn’t keep them in her Kirk ugh at all bc of the shape
customer_reviews.author: Kayla hatcher

customer_reviews.title: I like the way these look MUCH better than the hospital ...
customer_reviews.text: Daughter only used a few times. Never was a fan really. I like the way these look MUCH better than the hospital ones though. We primarily used MAM and others though. It's always good to try various pacifiers because every baby has a preference. Our daughter has changed which one she prefers as she gets older.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was happy to recieve these in the mail
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to recieve these in the mail, but upon opening the package the smell was very strong. I left the item air out for couple days, hoping the smell would dissipate, but it did not. I wish it didn't have the smell as the product would have been very nice otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: J&P

customer_reviews.title: Not Orthodontic Approved!!
customer_reviews.text: After my newborn used this paci for about 2 weeks his gum line started to form an indention. I immediately stopped using it and gave him the Avent for 0-3 months, and his gum line returned to normal in about a day. This also happened to a friends baby but they were to the point of taking him to a dentist to see what was wrong with his gum line. They were even recommended by their pediatrician to see a dentist and possibly an orthodontist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to wash, baby's fave
customer_reviews.text: These are my baby's favorite. They're not too long so he doesn't gag on them like some others I've tried. My first baby would take pretty much any pacifier, but my second is much pickier and will only take this kind. Definitely the easiest to wash out of all of them. Only negative: the nub does make it easy for him to knock out of his own mouth with his flailing hands and arms.
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: One of the few pacis that wouldn't invite mold to grow!
customer_reviews.text: ...Because they don't have a space that you can't get to or wash. These are the best. Other pacis that have the nipple that is a "closed loop" allow water to get into the nipples but won't allow the water out...So after a while, I can imagine mold growing inside the nipples. When I saw the water after I washed the other nipples, I just threw them away. These pacies, you can wash every aspect.
customer_reviews.author: braithe

customer_reviews.title: Best pacifiers
customer_reviews.text: Only pacifiers that stayed in newborn's mouth. Get these because all other brands fall out and then baby wakes up.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not the best for breastfed babies?
customer_reviews.text: My daughter didnt like these at all. The nipple part is so long, I dont get it. If you're breastfeeding, these probably wont work for your baby either. Just sayin.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: My pediatrician recommended these because of my sons tongue tie. At the beginning he struggled to take it but has gotten better over time.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: My son loooooves these!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because my preemie baby loved pacifiers but I hated that they covered his nose. These don't, and he loves them. He's 4 months old and still uses them. I gave them 4 stars because it's a great value and I like that his nose wasn't covered by them, but they're a rubbery material that everything sticks to. I have 2 dogs and I'm constantly picking dog hair and other random fuzzies off of them. That material just attracts everything. But overall, I love them!
customer_reviews.author: LindsMc1

customer_reviews.title: Best Pacifiers, My Babys Choice.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the blue ones twice. I love love love gumdrop pacifiers. They feel nice to the touch, and theyre the only ones my little boy would take from the time he was born. I can never find these in walmart, theyre ALWAYS sold out. Gave 4 stars because I ordered blue twice, and once I recieved pink and purple. That doesnt bother me one bit, but I know some people care very much about the color preference.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Powell

customer_reviews.title: Baby Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: These pacifiers are just as good as the popular Soothie pacifiers. They have pretty much the same nipple design, but the gumdrops have more of an oval shape over the mouth instead of a circle. My baby takes both and there isn't a lot of difference between the two, but I just think these are a little cuter. I like being able to buy them in 6 count instead of just 2 at a time. Stock up because pacifiers have a way of just disappearing it seems!
customer_reviews.author: Kavo

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pacifiers!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite pacifiers because unlike the advent ones they don't seem to fall out of the baby's mouth as easily. Plus now that he is teething he chews on them! I order a new set every 6 weeks (that's the recommended time for replacement by the doctor) so that I can have one in the crib, one in the car seat, one in the play pen, one in the pack n play, a couple in the diaper bag... well you get the idea ;)
customer_reviews.author: SurferGrrl

customer_reviews.title: Sleep well
customer_reviews.text: Good value for money. My baby daughter decided she wants only this type of pacifier so we bought a couple of them. Although they are a little more expensive then the others, they are doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: Tal

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great transition pacifier from the ugly hospital ones. Same nipple without the round base
customer_reviews.author: Stacy & Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as soothies
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my baby likes the soothie pacifiers they give you at the hospital and these were a cheaper option. She knows the difference and won't use them. Apparently my child is a binky aficionado. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: ali Cali

customer_reviews.title: These are good!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are best single piece pacifier, my six month old likes it. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Arjun

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love them and the only ones my son will take. There so hard to find and Amazon has them at the best price.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Gumdrop, a must have. . . .
customer_reviews.text: My son (now 8) would only use these, so its only fair to say his baby sister loves them as well. Must have for those babies who reject other types of pacifiers.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander The Great

customer_reviews.title: Nipple is shaped like a soothie but with better cutout for nose
customer_reviews.text: Nipple is shaped like a soothie but with better cutout for nose. I wish they made an animal to attach and that these were sold locally.
customer_reviews.author: amy t

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Baby Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pacifiers for our newborn. The nipple is short enough to not gag her despite her being born a tiny baby at just 5lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Walker Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Just in Time
customer_reviews.text: My son got his original pacifier from the hospital, they gave us two. So when I saw the great deal for the same kind here on Amazon I immediately ordered. It's always smart to have extras in case you lose it, there's nothing worse than an upset child who is used to a certain pacifier. As my luck would have it we lost his the same day the new ones arrived!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Slusher

customer_reviews.title: I figured these would be great due to the cut out by the nose
customer_reviews.text: My son likes the pacifier from the hospital, I figured these would be great due to the cut out by the nose. My son spits this pacifier out EVERY TIME. He does not like it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Maybe if they were a bit softer he would have liked them more
customer_reviews.text: Son didn't care for these. Thst are very hard. Maybe if they were a bit softer he would have liked them more.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Super cute vibrant colors. My son loves this style of pacifier.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Koepnick

product_meta.title: The First Years Gumdrop Newborn Pacifiers
product_meta.description: Color:Blue/Green| Size:2 PackMeet the baby’s first pacifier. Distributed in hospitals worldwide, GumDrop pacifiers have an innovative one-piece design constructed of durable, latex-free silicone. Available in bright colors, these newborn pacifiers are shaped to fit baby's face while staying clear of his or her nose. This 0-3 month pacifier is the perfect introductory pacifier to soothe your new addition.
feature_bullets: GUMDROP PACIFIERS: These latex-free silicone pacifiers are trusted by hospitals worldwide
UNIQUE CONTOUR SHAPE: Lightweight pacifiers are designed to fit baby's face without hiding nose
NEWBORN PACIFIERS: Available in bright colors and work with most pacifier attachers

specifications.Safety warning: All nipples can wear out with normal use over time. To prevent a possible choking hazard: Before each use test strength by pulling on nipple portion firmly; Replace immediately if nipple is enlarged or if any signs of cracks, tears, stickiness or excessive wear appear; Do not expose to excessive heat or direct sunlight for an extended period of time; Do not use if the child can place the entire pacifier in his or her mouth. As your baby gets older, the possibility of the whole pacifier fitting in the mouth increases. Do not leave child unattended with a pacifier. This product is not a toy. Do not allow children to play with it. Do not tie pacifier around child's neck as it presents a strangulation danger.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,651 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
